name: Level II lymph nodes
definition:
Lymph nodes located around the upper third of the internal jugular vein and adjacent spinal accessory nerve, extending from the hyoid bone (clinical landmark) to the skull base. The posterior boundary is the posterior border of the sternocleidomastoid muscle, and the anterior boundary is the lateral border of the sternohyoid muscle. 

Includes the following lymph nodes:
Jugulodigastric (subdigastric) 
Upper deep cervical
